Dear Sheffield City Council,
Personal Budgets for Education January 2025 update (information previously accessed January 2024)
Please could you answer the following questions in relation to your Local Education Authority:-
1.	How many children/young people within your Local Authority with an EHCP have no school or setting named in Section I of their Plan (as at Jan 25)?
2.	How many children/young people within your Local Authority with an EHCP are registered as being electively home educated (as at Jan 25)?
3.	How many children/young people within your Local Authority with an EHCP are registered as EOTAS/EOTIS/EOTIC (Educated Otherwise Than In a School or College as per Section 61 of the Children & Families Act 2014) (as at Jan 25)
4.	How many children/young people within your Local Authority have been awarded and currently access Personal Budgets for Education (as at Jan 25)?
5.	How many of the Personal Budgets for Education currently accessed have been provided as part of an Education Otherwise Than At/In School or College (EOTAS(C)/EOTIS(C)) provision described in their Education Health and Care Plan (as at Jan 25)?
6.	How many of the Personal Budgets for Education currently accessed have been awarded to children/young people who are being Electively Home Educated (EHE) (as at Jan 25)?
7.	How many of the Personal Budgets for Education currently being accessed are awarded in the form of Direct Payments to families (as at Jan 25)?
8.	What is the total annual cost of Personal Budgets for Education within your Local Authority (as at Jan 25)?
9.	What is the total annual cost of Personal Budgets for Education allocated as Direct Payments to families within your Local Authority (as at Jan 25)?
I very much appreciate your response in this matter.
Yours faithfully,
Sarah Lockwood

Dear Sarah Lockwood,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Personal Budgets in
Education 2025 which we received on 18/01/2025.
We apologise for the delay in providing a response. Please find Sheffield
City Council’s response to your request set out below:
1.         How many children/young people within your Local Authority with
an EHCP have no school or setting named in Section I of their Plan (as at
Jan 25)?
On 28^th January 2025, there were 24 pupils listed as ‘Pupil Not on Roll’.
These numbers will, however, include pupils who do have a setting named in
section I, but are not attending the setting due to several possible
factors.
At the point of finalising an EHCP, there are occasions when a setting
‘type’ is named in Section I while the LA works to secure an appropriate
placement. A pupil may continue to attend their current setting, until a
transition into a new setting can be arranged. In this instance, their new
EHCP would contain only a setting ‘type’ in Section I, and not a named
setting. This information is recorded only within their E-File, not within
an information management system. On 28^th January 2025, there were 6246
Pupils with a SEN Status E in the city. It takes an average of 1 minute to
locate the E-File and record the information in section I. It would
therefore take more than 100 hours to conclusively determine the answer to
this question.
2.         How many children/young people within your Local Authority with
an EHCP are registered as being electively home educated (as at Jan 25)?
51
3.         How many children/young people within your Local Authority with
an EHCP are registered as EOTAS/EOTIS/EOTIC (Educated Otherwise Than In a
School or College as per Section 61 of the Children & Families Act 2014)
(as at Jan 25)
56
4.         How many children/young people within your Local Authority have
been awarded and currently access Personal Budgets for Education (as at
Jan 25)?
65
5.         How many of the Personal Budgets for Education currently
accessed have been provided as part of an Education Otherwise Than At/In
School or College (EOTAS(C)/EOTIS(C)) provision described in their
Education Health and Care Plan (as at Jan 25)?
31
6.         How many of the Personal Budgets for Education currently
accessed have been awarded to children/young people who are being
Electively Home Educated (EHE) (as at Jan 25)?
0
7.         How many of the Personal Budgets for Education currently being
accessed are awarded in the form of Direct Payments to families (as at Jan
25)?
65
8.         What is the total annual cost of Personal Budgets for Education
within your Local Authority (as at Jan 25)?
£497,206.00
9.         What is the total annual cost of Personal Budgets for Education
allocated as Direct Payments to families within your Local Authority (as
at Jan 25)?
£497,206.00
Data Captured 28.01.2025
